intro: Mariosousa centralis, commonly known as the Central Island mariosousa, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
